intro: Rostraria obtusiflora, commonly known as the broad-flowered rostraria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that resemble a beak or rostrum. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Rostraria obtusiflora is of interest to botanists due to its specialized morphology and ecological adaptations.
